Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the ConfigurationSet.

IamRoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity and Access Management role that is able to write event data to an Amazon CloudWatch destination.

LogGroupArn.description: The name of the Amazon CloudWatch log group that you want to record events in.

CloudWatchLogsDestination.description: Contains the destination configuration to use when publishing message sending events.
An object that contains information about an event destination that sends logging events to Amazon CloudWatch logs.

Enabled.description: When set to true events will be logged.

KinesisFirehoseDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination for logging to Amazon Data Firehose.

MatchingEventTypes.description:
An array of event types that determine which events to log.

> The `TEXT_SENT` event type is not supported.

SnsDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination that sends logging events to Amazon SNS.

EventDestination.description:
Contains information about an event destination.

Event destinations are associated with configuration sets, which enable you to publish message sending events to CloudWatch, Firehose, or Amazon SNS.

DeliveryStreamArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream.

IamRoleArn.description: The ARN of an AWS Identity and Access Management role that is able to write event data to an Amazon Data Firehose destination.

KinesisFirehoseDestination.description:
Contains the delivery stream Amazon Resource Name (ARN), and the ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role associated with a Firehose event destination.

Event destinations, such as Firehose, are associated with configuration sets, which enable you to publish message sending events.

TopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want to publish events to.

SnsDestination.description: An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for events. You can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain events occur.

description:
Creates a new configuration set. After you create the configuration set, you can add one or more event destinations to it.

A configuration set is a set of rules that you apply to the SMS and voice messages that you send.

When you send a message, you can optionally specify a single configuration set.

DefaultSenderId.description: The default sender ID used by the ConfigurationSet.

EventDestinations.description: An array of EventDestination objects that describe any events to log and where to log them.

MessageFeedbackEnabled.description: Set to true to enable feedback for the message.

ProtectConfigurationId.description: The unique identifier for the protect configuration.

Tags.description: An array of key and value pair tags that's associated with the new configuration set.
